Then if "save.txt" contains something like "hello, World" then it works fine. However, with the following text the text in "save.txt" the page does not display: 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:06:01 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:07:26 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:09:06 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:10:59 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:18:48 147.114.80.135 on 2006/06/09 11:43:49 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/09 14:05:33 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/09 14:06:06 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/09 14:08:00 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/23 14:58:37 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/23 15:21:43 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/23 15:23:07 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/23 15:23:18 147.114.81.82 on 2006/06/27 12:47:31 147.114.81.82 on 2006/07/10 09:32:17 147.114.81.82 on 2006/07/18 16:20:08 147.114.56.116 on 2006/10/26 18:23:20 127.0.0.1 on 2006/10/31 15:22:40 127.0.0.1 on 2006/10/31 15:56:04 147.114.62.148 on 2006/11/01 16:25:09 It either times out after a long time with IE complaining "Cannot find server or DNS Error", or if interrupted displays this: 1c 0 Source code for this looks like: 1c 0 The apache version is 2.2.2 and the directives are: Options Includes AddType text/html .shtml AddType application/x-httpd-php .php .phtml .html # AddOutputFilter INCLUDES .shtml AddHandler server-parsed .shtml Sorry I don't have time to test with the latest version. I've logged this against mod_include, not because we load that explicitly (we don't), but because that's presumably the area of code that's at fault here? Regards, David.

creator: tam@math.ubc.ca
text:
I have the same bug described here.

The mod_include produced some bizarre output and is sensitive to the input
(i.e. a blank space included would trigger it or remove the problem).
It seems to spit out random hex-codes (in ascii) once in a while into its
output stream.  The same documents served up with our previous version
(2.0.53) works perfectly.
 
Things I have tried:

        - changed MPM: prefork, worker.
        - changed/eliminated optimization.
        - removed/added other modules (e.g. SSL, PHP, etc.)
        - simplified httpd.conf.
        - turn on/off eAccelerator PHP cache.

The version with the problem is 2.2.3.  The problem can be viewed at

        http://www.math.ubc.ca/
                - what it should display

        http://wtest1.math.ubc.ca/
                - the same documents served up with httpd/mod_include 2.2.3.
